channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Apply to be one of our Summer 2025 Arch Ambassadors!
item.description: Become a leader, connector, and advocate for your peers as an Arch Ambassador! This on campus role offers the chance to enhance your leadership skills while supporting your Arch cohort through engaging events and activities. If you’re ready to make a difference, build lasting relationships, and develop as a leader, apply to become an Arch Ambassador today on Handshake!
item.author: Students

item.title: Spring Graduate Lunch and Learn Series- Post-degree work authorizations | April 9 (Registration Required)
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 9, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:30 PM - Join International Services and speakers from NZP Law Group to learn about post-degree work on Optional Practical Training (OPT) and STEM OPT, & immigration options after the F-1 visa. ISSS will provide information about OPT and STEM OPT and NPZ will share the options to consider beyond the F-1 visa. Seating is limited. Lunch will be served from 12-12:30.REGISTRATION IS REQUIRED. To Register email Noelle Sanchez (sanchn2@rpi.edu)Location:…
item.author: Students

item.title: McKinney Keynote: Creative Writing Craft Talk Slated for April 8
item.description: Please join us on Tues, 4/8 at 2PM in EMPAC Studio Beta for a craft talk by award-winning novelist and McKinney keynote speaker, Lan Samantha Chang. Chang is the winner of an Anisfield-Wolf Book Award for Fiction and a PEN Open Book Award. She’s received fellowships from the National Endowment for the Arts, the Guggenheim Foundation, and an award from the American Academy of Arts and Letters. Chang will be discussing the craft of fiction and her writing process. Registration is not required.
item.author: Students

item.title: What’s Next After Graduation?
item.description: RPI students consistently excel, with placement rates ranging from 91–95% in recent years. In 2023, among those placed, 56% secured employment, 33% enrolled in graduate school, and 11% pursued other opportunities, including military service, travel abroad, the Peace Corps, non-traditional employment, and entrepreneurship. Curious to learn more? Dive into Standard 5 of RPI’s Self-Study for Middle States Accreditation, a team led by Dr. Brett Fajen and Dr. Matt Oehlschlaeger.
item.author: Community

item.title: Pittsburgh | Truths and Myths about Self-Driving Car Safety (Virtual) | April 9
item.description: Date: 4/9/2025 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM The RPI Pittsburgh Alumni Chapter is back and ready for action. This event will be a live webinar about “Truths and Myths of Self-Driving Car Safety.” It will be presented beginning at 7 p.m. EST by alumnus Philip Koopman ’82G. Professor Koopman is an internationally recognized expert on Autonomous Vehicle (AV) safety whose work in that area spans over 25 years. He has been involved with AV policy and standards as well as more general embedded…
item.author: Community

item.title: ISATMA 2025 Workshop: Neurodivergent Knowing and Creating | April 9
item.description: Wednesday, April 9, 2025 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM The International Symposium on Assistive Technology for Music and Art started as a forum for researchers and artists dealing with the physical limitations of the human body and with embodiment in general. Join us for a panel focused on neurodivergent media, thinking, scholarship, pedagogy, and crip curation. Discussion includes opening and closing 30-minute periods to gather and rest in a 360-degree space of ambient sound and moving image.
item.author: Community

item.title: Math Coloquium & Annual AWM Seminar: Jennifer Crodelle (Middlebury College) | April 7
item.description: Date: Monday, April 7, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - This Mathematical Sciences Colloquium and Annual AWM Seminar will feature a presentation titled “The effect of retinal waves on the formation of visual receptive fields” by Dr. Jen Crodelle, Assistant Professor of Mathematics at Middlebury College in VT.
item.author: Community

item.title: Math Sciences Department - Class of ’27 Lecture Series | April 8 & April 9
item.description: Date: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - The Class of ’27 Lecture Series, established in 1960 to honor the first chair of the Math Sciences Department, holds two special lectures annually. Lecture I, on April 8, will present “Eigenmatrix for Unstructured Sparse Recovery”. Lecture II, on April 9, features “NRandomness in phase estimation and Heisenberg-limited Hamiltonian learning”, by speaker Lexing Ying from Stanford University.
item.author: Community

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia: Jaemin Cho - Modular and Interpretable Multimodal AI for Improved Generation and Evaluation | April 7
item.description: Monday, April 7, 2025 9:00 AM - 10:00 AM - : Jaemin Cho is a PhD candidate at the Department of Computer Science at UNC-Chapel Hill. His work has been featured at top conferences in computer vision, natural language processing, and machine learning. His work has been recognized through multiple oral presentations at NeurIPS and ICLR, the Bloomberg Data Science PhD Fellowship, and coverage (MIT Technology Review, IEEE Spectrum, and WIRED).
item.author: Community

item.title: Process, Production, Pedagogy with Suzi Analog | April 10
item.description: Thursday / April 10, 2025 at 2:00 pm Suzi Analog, music professor at UNC, prolific producer, songwriter, composer, founder of Never Normal Records, is based in Miami, FL. Her work pioneers the new wave of women producers in electronic music and beyond. Her recent project commissioned by Alfreda Cinema and Brooklyn Academy of Music, BY ANY MEANZ SONICALLY, is a live electronic score set to a visual montage highlighting profound influence of Black women in electronic dance music, tracing their…
item.author: Community

item.title: 10th Annual Graduate Research Symposium | April 11
item.description: Date: Friday, April 11, 2025 1:00 PM - 5:30 PM - Register to attend the 10th Annual Graduate Research Symposium featuring graduate student podium presentations, the Three Minute Thesis Competition, graduate student poster presentations, and a networking reception.
item.author: Community

item.title: National Academy of Engineering 2025 Bernard M. Gordon Prize Ceremony | April 16 (RSVP)
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 3:00 PM - 5:00 PM - National Academy of Engineering presents the 2025 Bernard M. Gordon Prize for Innovation in Engineering and Technology Education to Prof. Georges Belfort and Prof. Steven Cramer. Location: CBIS, Howard P. Isermann Auditorium. Ceremony and Reception RSVP: https://webforms.rpi.edu/gordon-prize-ceremony

item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 9, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM DCC 324- Title and abstract to be announced.
item.author: Community

item.title: Advanced Digital Imaging Spring Exhibition Opening Reception to be held April 8
item.description: The opening reception of Advanced Digital Imaging Spring 2025 Exhibition is on Tuesday April 8, 6 to 7pm in SAGE Lab 5th floor Dean’s Gallery. The exhibition consists of works-in-progress and short study projects created in class in response to studies in gesture, emotion, the human body, virtual and augmented realities, and expanded notions of perception and time. Included in the exhibition are multimedia, photography, archival digital and hand drawn works on paper, canvas, and other materials.
item.author: Community

item.title: MSE Seminar: Dr. Talat Rahman | April 9
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 9, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM in Low 4050 - A walk through the world of reduced dimensionality in search of materials with novel functionality Talat Rahman Department of Physics University of Central Florida
item.author: Community

item.title: Leaders in Action Conversation with President of Pintail Power, Dr. William Conlon ’75, ’76G, ’82Ph.D. scheduled for April 7
item.description: Date: Monday, April 7, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Date: Monday April 7, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM During this session, host Prof. Azita Hirsa and Dr. William Conlon ’75, ’76G, ’82Ph.D.,President of Pintail Power will discuss the Power of Engineering Decisions in the 21st Century. Participants will be able to ask relevant questions; refreshments will be served following the session.
item.author: Community

item.title: CBE Van Ness Seminar Features Dr. Sujit Datta | April 9
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 9, 2025 9:15 AM - 10:30 AM - The 2025 CBE Van Ness Award Lecture features Dr. Sujit Datta, professor of Chemical Engineering, Bioengineering, and Biophysics at Caltech. Dr. Datta’s seminar, “Watching Microbial Life in Complex Environments,” is open to all. Refreshments will be available at 8:45 a.m. in the Ricketts Coonley Lounge (RI 120).
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Graduate Certificate Review on April 8
item.description: Date: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., in a 30-minute information session highlighting the whole range of Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs. These certificates are three courses in length, developing targeted ability groups, and can be completed in as little as seven months. Please complete the form below if you plan to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia - Ke Wang - Beyond the Phase Ordering Problem: Finding the Globally Optimal Code with Respect to Optimization Phases | April 9
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 9, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Ke Wang is currently a visiting scholar at Stanford University. His work received a Distinguished Paper Award at OOPSLA 2020. He has served on the program committee for PLDI in 2020, 2021, 2023, and 2025. Prior to joining Visa Research, Dr. Wang obtained his PhD from UC Davis, where he was awarded twice in 2015 and 2018 an Honorable Mention for Outstanding Graduate Research in the Computer Science Department. He also worked at Siemens…
item.author: Community

item.title: Show Your Support for RPI’s MSCHE Reaccreditation! | April 7
item.description: Date: Monday, April 7, 2025 11:10 AM - 3:30 PM - As part of the Middle States Accreditation final on-campus visit, the visiting team will host two sessions on Monday, April 7, to experience our vibe, culture, and community environment. Staff Session: 11:10 AM – 12:00 PM; Faculty Session: 2:30 – 3:30 PM. Faculty and staff are encouraged to participate—your input and support are invaluable!
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Sharing Success: Faculty Share Their Experience as Innovative Pedagogy Fellows | April 9
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, April 9, 2025 11:45 AM - 1:45 PM - Come learn how your colleagues successfully used new teaching approaches to engage students and increase their learning. Nine faculty who were selected as Innovative Pedagogy Fellows in 2024 have been invited to share what they did and how they did it in a special 2-part Lunch and Learn series in April. This series is generously sponsored by the Lally School of Management and Technology. Session 2, April 9, will feature Fellows who used Role…

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
